meanings.sent2: The author prosified the lyrical piece to make it easier to understand.
meanings.sent3: The teacher prosified the complex text, turning it into a straightforward narrative.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were prosified into plain words on the page.
meanings.sent5: He prosified the ancient tale, making it accessible to all.

meanings.definition: Written or spoken in prose form.
meanings.sent1: The prosified version of the play was easier for the students to follow.
meanings.sent2: Her prosified speech was clear and direct, without any poetic language.
meanings.sent3: The prosified essay lacked the flowery language of traditional poetry.
meanings.sent4: His prosified writing style was appreciated for its simplicity and clarity.
meanings.sent5: The prosified novel was a refreshing change from the usual poetic works.
